alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Jackson; Lincoln; Ouachita; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jackson, central Union, Ouachita, northeastern Bienville and Lincoln Parishes through 100 AM CDT... At 1200 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bernice to 7 miles northeast of Ruston to 12 miles east of Ringgold. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Ruston, Claiborne, West Monroe, Grambling, Jonesboro, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Farmerville, Richwood, Bernice, Sterlington, Cooley, Dubach, Choudrant, Simsboro, Chatham, Hodge and North Hodge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.
